action: Scroll 'Scroll down to view email input field'
observation: I can see a sign-up page with form fields for email and password. As an elderly user, I need to scroll down to see the sign-up form properly since the email and password fields appear to be positioned very low on the page (y-coordinates around 1700-1800). I can see the email input field and password field in the elements list, but they are likely not visible in the current viewport.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user with limited tech experience, I need to be able to see the form fields clearly to fill them out. The form elements are positioned very low on the page based on their coordinates, so I need to scroll down to bring them into view where I can interact with them properly.
ux_issues: Form fields positioned too far down the page, requiring scrolling to access basic sign-up functionality

outcome.visual_observation: UX issues detected: Form fields positioned too far down the page, requiring scrolling to access basic sign-up functionality
outcome.diagnosis: Analysis completed - see evidence for details

evidence.actual_outcome: Scroll 'Scroll down to view email input field'

issues: Form fields positioned too far down the page, requiring scrolling to access basic sign-up functionality

dual_diagnosis.visual_observation: The screen changed from a mostly empty page with two empty colored boxes to displaying a complete 'Create your account' sign-up form. The form includes email address input field (with placeholder 'you@example.com'), password input field (with placeholder dots), password requirements text ('Must be at least 8 characters'), a 'Next' button, and a 'Sign in' link for existing users.
